HudsonTpcPlugin.name: HudsonTpcPlugin
HudsonTpcPlugin.excerpt: This plugin publish test results of jobs to Oracle Team Productivity Center.
HudsonTpcPlugin.title: Oracle Team Productivity Center Plugin

developers.name: Many
developers.developerId: kohsuke abayer dodok1 dty huybrechts mindless pgweiss stephenconnolly rseguy wjprakash akozak 8nevil8 christ66 jjlauterbach

ssh-slaves.name: ssh-slaves
ssh-slaves.excerpt: Plugin allows you to manage slaves running on *nix machines over SSH.
ssh-slaves.title: Hudson SSH Slaves plugin

git.name: git
git.excerpt: This plugin allows use of GIT as a build SCM. Git 1.3.3 or newer is required. \\
git.title: Git Plugin

project-health-report.name: project-health-report
project-health-report.excerpt: This Hudson/Jenkins plugin shows project health.
project-health-report.title: Project Health Report

upstream-downstream-view.name: upstream-downstream-view
upstream-downstream-view.excerpt: Provides the new column view for Upstreamed/Downstreamed jobs.
upstream-downstream-view.title: Hudson Upstream Downstream Column Plugin

BuildPipelinePlugin.name: BuildPipelinePlugin
BuildPipelinePlugin.excerpt: This plugin provides build pipeline functionality to Hudson and Jenkins.  This allows a chain of jobs to be visualised in a new view.  Manual jobs in the pipeline can be triggered by a user with the appropriate permissions manually confirming.
BuildPipelinePlugin.title: Build Pipeline Plugin

BlameSubversion.name: BlameSubversion
BlameSubversion.excerpt: This plug-in provides utilities for getting svn info from upstream job to downstream job
BlameSubversion.title: Hudson Blame Subversion Plug-in

LavaLampNotifier.name: LavaLampNotifier
LavaLampNotifier.excerpt: Indicate Hudson Job status using a Lava Lamp
LavaLampNotifier.title: Lava Lamp Notifier

PrioritySorter.name: PrioritySorter
PrioritySorter.excerpt: This plugin allows for the build queue to be sorted based on pre-assigned priorities for each job.
PrioritySorter.title: Priority Sorter Plugin

SCTMExecutor.name: SCTMExecutor
SCTMExecutor.excerpt: This plugin will let users use Borland's SilkCentral Test Manager 2008 R2 or later.
SCTMExecutor.title: SCTMExecutor

Schmant.name: Schmant
Schmant.excerpt: The Schmant plugin enables Hudson to run Schmant build scripts.
Schmant.title: Schmant Plugin

URLSCM.name: URLSCM
URLSCM.excerpt: This plugin allows the use of URLs as an SCM.
URLSCM.title: URL SCM

WebSVN2.name: WebSVN2
WebSVN2.excerpt: This plugin integrates WebSVN Version 2 browser interface for Subversion with Hudson.
WebSVN2.title: WebSVN2 Plugin

accurev.name: accurev
accurev.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use AccuRev as a SCM.
accurev.title: Accurev Plugin

active-directory.name: active-directory
active-directory.excerpt: With this plugin, you can configure Hudson authenticates the username and the password through Active Directory.
active-directory.title: Active Directory plugin

analysis-collector.name: analysis-collector
analysis-collector.excerpt: This plug-in is an add-on for the plug-ins Checkstyle, Dry, FindBugs, PMD, Task Scanner, and Warnings: the plug-in collects the different analysis results and shows the results in a combined trend graph. Additionally, the plug-in provides health reporting and build stability based on these combined results.
analysis-collector.title: Analysis Collector Plugin

android-emulator.name: android-emulator
android-emulator.excerpt: Lets you automatically generate and run an Android emulator for the duration of a build, with the emulator logs being captured as artifacts.
android-emulator.title: Android Emulator Plugin

artifactory.name: artifactory
artifactory.excerpt: This plugin allows deploying Maven 2, Maven 3, Ivy and Gradle artifacts and build info to the Artifactory artifacts manager.
artifactory.title: Artifactory Plugin

audit-trail.name: audit-trail
audit-trail.excerpt: Keep a log of who performed particular Hudson operations, such as configuring jobs.
audit-trail.title: Audit Trail Plugin

backlog.name: backlog
backlog.excerpt: This plugin integrates Backlog to Hudson.
backlog.title: Backlog Plugin

backup.name: backup
backup.excerpt: Backup plugin allows archiving and restoring your Jenkins (and Hudson) home directory.
backup.title: Backup Plugin

bamboo-notifier.name: bamboo-notifier
bamboo-notifier.excerpt: Trigger a Bamboo build upon successful completion of a Hudson job.
bamboo-notifier.title: Bamboo Notifier

batch-task.name: batch-task
batch-task.excerpt: This plugin adds batch tasks that are not regularly executed to projects, such as releases, integration, archiving, etc.
batch-task.title: Batch Task Plugin

bazaar.name: bazaar
bazaar.excerpt: This plugin integrates Bazaar version control system to Hudson. The plugin requires the Bazaar binary (bzr) to be installed on the target machine.
bazaar.title: Bazaar Plugin

blame-upstream-commiters.name: blame-upstream-commiters
blame-upstream-commiters.excerpt: This is a simple plugin that adds a post build action to mail upstream committers when a build fails.
blame-upstream-commiters.title: Blame Upstream Committers Plugin

bruceschneier.name: bruceschneier
bruceschneier.excerpt: Displays a picture of Bruce Schneier (instead of Hudson the butler) and a random Bruce Schneier fact on each build page.
bruceschneier.title: BruceSchneier Plugin

buckminster.name: buckminster
buckminster.excerpt: This PlugIn integrates Eclipse Buckminster as a new build step into hudson.
buckminster.title: Buckminster PlugIn

bugzilla.name: bugzilla
bugzilla.excerpt: Bugzilla integration - link bugs in changeset descriptions
bugzilla.title: Bugzilla Plugin

build-publisher.name: build-publisher
build-publisher.excerpt: This plugin allows records from one Hudson to be published on another Hudson.
build-publisher.title: Build Publisher Plugin

build-timeout.name: build-timeout
build-timeout.excerpt: This plugin allows you to automatically abort a build if it's taking too long.
build-timeout.title: Build-timeout Plugin

campfire.name: campfire
campfire.excerpt: This plugin allows your team to setup build notifications to be sent to Campfire rooms.
campfire.title: Campfire Plugin

cas1.name: cas1
cas1.excerpt: This plugin lets Hudson authenticate users via your organization's Central Authentication Service (CAS), for single-sign-on.
cas1.title: CAS1 Plugin

ccm.name: ccm
ccm.excerpt: This plug-in generates reports on cyclomatic complexity for .NET code.
ccm.title: CCM Plugin

changelog-history.name: changelog-history
changelog-history.excerpt: This plugin copies change log data to a later build when a build is deleted.
changelog-history.title: Change Log History Plugin

chucknorris.name: chucknorris
chucknorris.excerpt: Displays a picture of Chuck Norris (instead of Hudson the butler) and a random Chuck Norris 'The Programmer' fact on each build page.
chucknorris.title: ChuckNorris Plugin

ci-game.name: ci-game
ci-game.excerpt: This plugin introduces a game where users gets point on improving the builds.
ci-game.title: The Continuous Integration Game plugin

cifs.name: cifs
cifs.excerpt: This plugin uploads build artifacts to repository sites using CIFS (SMB) protocol.
cifs.title: CIFS-Publisher Plugin

claim.name: claim
claim.excerpt: This plugin allows users to claim failed builds
claim.title: Claim plugin

clone-workspace-scm.name: clone-workspace-scm
clone-workspace-scm.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to archive the workspace from builds of one project and reuse them as the SCM source for another project.
clone-workspace-scm.title: Clone Workspace SCM Plugin

clover.name: clover
clover.excerpt: This plugin allows you to capture code coverage reports from Clover. Hudson will generate and track code coverage across time. This plugin can be used without the need to modify your build.xml.
clover.title: Hudson Clover plugin

cmakebuilder.name: cmakebuilder
cmakebuilder.excerpt: This plugin can be used to build cmake based projects within Hudson.
cmakebuilder.title: cmakebuilder Plugin

cobertura.name: cobertura
cobertura.excerpt: This plugin allows you to capture code coverage report from Cobertura. Hudson will generate the trend report of coverage.
cobertura.title: Cobertura Plugin

codescanner.name: codescanner
codescanner.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for Codescanner, a tool which uses static analysis to look for bugs, hints and other useful information in Symbian C++ source code.
codescanner.title: CodeScanner Plugin

collabnet.name: collabnet
collabnet.excerpt: The CollabNet Plugin is an integration with CollabNet TeamForge.
collabnet.title: CollabNet Plugin

collapsing-console-sections.name: collapsing-console-sections
collapsing-console-sections.excerpt: This plugin allows the creation of sections in build consoles.
collapsing-console-sections.title: Collapsing Console Sections Plugin

compact-columns.name: compact-columns
compact-columns.excerpt: More compact columns for showing last success and failure. Easier to understand, and takes less room in your view.
compact-columns.title: Compact Columns

concordionpresenter.name: concordionpresenter
concordionpresenter.excerpt: This plugin publishes Concordion test reports for each build
concordionpresenter.title: Concordion Presenter Plugin

configurationslicing.name: configurationslicing
configurationslicing.excerpt: Perform mass configuration of select project properties, including email, timer, discard old builds, and Maven configuration.
configurationslicing.title: Configuration Slicing Plugin

copyarchiver.name: copyarchiver
copyarchiver.excerpt: The objective is to aggregate archived artifacts from several jobs into a shared directory. For each job, only archived artifacts of the last success build will be copied.
copyarchiver.title: CopyArchiver Plugin

copyartifact.name: copyartifact
copyartifact.excerpt: Adds a build step to copy artifacts from another project.
copyartifact.title: Copy Artifact Plugin

covcomplplot.name: covcomplplot
covcomplplot.excerpt: This plugin shows the coverage/complexity scatter plot from Clover Hudson plugin results.
covcomplplot.title: Coverage Complexity Scatter Plot PlugIn

cppunit.name: cppunit
cppunit.excerpt: This plugin enables you to publish CppUnit test results.
cppunit.title: CppUnit Plugin

crap4j.name: crap4j
crap4j.excerpt: This plugin reads the "crappy methods" report from Crap4J. Hudson will generate the trend report of crap percentage and provide detailed information about changes.
crap4j.title: Crap4J Plugin

createjobadvanced.name: createjobadvanced
createjobadvanced.excerpt: This plugin extends creating job. When you create a job, it sets automatically all rights on the creator.
createjobadvanced.title: Create Job Advanced Plugin

cron_column.name: cron_column
cron_column.excerpt: View column showing the cron trigger expressions that can be configured on a job (Subversion, Scheduled Builds, etc.)
cron_column.title: Cron Column Plugin

crowd.name: crowd
crowd.excerpt: This plugin enables use of Atlassian Crowd as an authentication source.
crowd.title: Crowd Plugin

cvs-tag.name: cvs-tag
cvs-tag.excerpt: This plugin will perform CVS tagging (specifically cvs rtag) after a job has been built successfully.
cvs-tag.title: CVS Tagging Plugin

cygpath.name: cygpath
cygpath.excerpt: This plugin performs Cygwin path conversion before forking new processes
cygpath.title: Cygpath Plugin

dashboard-view.name: dashboard-view
dashboard-view.excerpt: This plugin contributes a new view implementation that provides a dashboard / portal-like view for your Hudson instance.
dashboard-view.title: Dashboard View

dbCharts.name: dbCharts
dbCharts.excerpt: Add charts based on JDBC database data series to the hudson.
dbCharts.title: dbCharts Plugin

dependencyanalyzer.name: dependencyanalyzer
dependencyanalyzer.excerpt: This plugin parses dependency:analyze goal from maven build logs and generates a dependency report
dependencyanalyzer.title: Dependency Analyzer Plugin

depgraph-view.name: depgraph-view
depgraph-view.excerpt: Shows the dependency graph of the Hudson projects using graphviz. Requires a graphviz installation on the server.
depgraph-view.title: Dependency Graph View Plugin

deploy.name: deploy
deploy.excerpt: Plugin to deploy ear/war build artifacts to remote Application Servers. Supported Servers are JBoss 3/4/6, Glassfish 2/3, Tomcat 5/6/7.
deploy.title: Hudson Deploy Plugin

deploy-websphere.name: deploy-websphere
deploy-websphere.excerpt: This plugin is an extension of the [Deploy Plugin]. It takes a war/ear file and deploys that to a running remote WebSphere Application Server at the end of a build.
deploy-websphere.title: Deploy WebSphere Plugin

description-setter.name: description-setter
description-setter.excerpt: This plugin sets the description for each build, based upon a RegEx test of the build log file.
description-setter.title: Description Setter Plugin

dimensionsscm.name: dimensionsscm
dimensionsscm.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson with Dimensions, the Serena SCM solution.
dimensionsscm.title: Dimensions Plugin

distTest.name: distTest
distTest.excerpt: This plugin allows distribute JUnit tests to all slaves in a specified label for a project.
distTest.title: DistTest Plugin

distfork.name: distfork
distfork.excerpt: Turns a Hudson cluster into a general purpose batch job execution environment through an SSH-like CLI.
distfork.title: DistFork Plugin

doclinks.name: doclinks
doclinks.excerpt: This plugin allows you to publish your documents that are created in the build steps.
doclinks.title: DocLinks Plugin

dos-trigger.name: dos-trigger
dos-trigger.excerpt: This plugin allows to trigger a build with a DOS script.
dos-trigger.title: DOS Trigger

downstream-buildview.name: downstream-buildview
downstream-buildview.excerpt: This plugin allows you to view the full status all the downstream builds so that we can graphically see that everything for this build has been completed successfully.
downstream-buildview.title: Downstream buildview plugin

downstream-ext.name: downstream-ext
downstream-ext.excerpt: This plugin supports extended configuration for triggering downstream builds: * trigger build only if downstream job has SCM changes * trigger build if upstream build result is better/equal/worse than any given result (SUCCESS, UNSTABLE, FAILURE, ABORTED) * for Matrix (alias multi-configuration) jobs you can decide which part of the job should trigger the downstream job: parent only, configurations only or both
downstream-ext.title: Downstream-Ext Plugin

dropdown-viewstabbar-plugin.name: dropdown-viewstabbar-plugin
dropdown-viewstabbar-plugin.excerpt: This plugin provides an alternate rendering of the Views bar which runs along the top of all views. This plugin is useful for instances which have a very large number of views and want a compact rendering.
dropdown-viewstabbar-plugin.title: DropDown ViewsTabBar Plugin

dry.name: dry
dry.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for duplicate code checkers like CPD.
dry.title: DRY Plugin

dumpinfo-buildwrapper-plugin.name: dumpinfo-buildwrapper-plugin
dumpinfo-buildwrapper-plugin.excerpt: Dumps vital information about the Hudson instance into the job log. This plugin is useful for historical and audit purposes, where you can see what versions of Hudson, slaves, and plugins were around at the time of a build.
dumpinfo-buildwrapper-plugin.title: DumpInfo BuildWrapper Plugin

easyant.name: easyant
easyant.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke EasyAnt build script as the main build step.
easyant.title: EasyAnt Plugin

ec2.name: ec2
ec2.excerpt: Allow Hudson to start slaves on EC2 or Ubuntu Enterprise Cloud (Eucalyptus) on demand, and kill them as they get unused.
ec2.title: Amazon EC2 Plugin

email-ext.name: email-ext
email-ext.excerpt: This plugin allows you to configure every aspect of email notifications. You can customize when an email is sent, who should receive it, and what the email says.
email-ext.title: Email-ext plugin

emma.name: emma
emma.excerpt: This plugin allows you to capture code coverage report from Emma. Jenkins will generate the trend report of coverage.
emma.title: Emma Plugin

emotional-hudson.name: emotional-hudson
emotional-hudson.excerpt: This funny plugin changes the expression of Mr. Hudson in the background when your builds fail.
emotional-hudson.title: Emotional Hudson Plugin

envfile.name: envfile
envfile.excerpt: This plugin enables you to set environment variables through a file. The file should follow the standard key and value pair format.  The file is always retrieved from the file system of the Hudson master node, even in distributed setups with slave nodes.
envfile.title: Envfile Plugin

exclusive-execution.name: exclusive-execution
exclusive-execution.excerpt: This plugin allows for the execution of a job when no other jobs are running.
exclusive-execution.title: Hudson Exclusive Execution Plugin

extended-choice-parameter.name: extended-choice-parameter
extended-choice-parameter.excerpt: Adds extended functionality to Choice parameter.
extended-choice-parameter.title: Extended Choice Parameter plugin

extended-read-permission.name: extended-read-permission
extended-read-permission.excerpt: This plugin enables the Extended Read permission in Hudson 1.324 and newer.
extended-read-permission.title: Extended Read Permission Plugin

favorite.name: favorite
favorite.excerpt: This plugin allows you to mark a job a favorite.
favorite.title: Favorite Plugin

files-found-trigger.name: files-found-trigger
files-found-trigger.excerpt: Build trigger that polls a directory and starts a build if certain files are found within that directory.
files-found-trigger.title: Files Found Trigger

fitnesse.name: fitnesse
fitnesse.excerpt: This plugin can be used to both execute and report on Fitnesse tests so that they can be integrated into a Hudson build.
fitnesse.title: Fitnesse Plugin

flashlog-plugin.name: flashlog-plugin
flashlog-plugin.excerpt: Captures Adobe Flash Player logs during a Hudson build in order to save them as build artifacts. Useful to debug unit tests or integration tests.
flashlog-plugin.title: FlashLog Plugin

fortify360.name: fortify360
fortify360.excerpt: Fortify 360 FPR post-processing and uploading to Fortify 360 Server
fortify360.title: Fortify 360 Plugin

ftppublisher.name: ftppublisher
ftppublisher.excerpt: This plugin can be used to upload project artifacts and whole directories to an ftp server.
ftppublisher.title: FTP-Publisher Plugin

gant.name: gant
gant.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke Gant build script as the main build step.
gant.title: Gant Plugin

gcal.name: gcal
gcal.excerpt: This plugin publishes build records over to Google Calendar
gcal.title: Google Calendar Plugin

gerrit-trigger.name: gerrit-trigger
gerrit-trigger.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson to Gerrit code review for triggering builds when a "patch set" is created. \\
gerrit-trigger.title: Gerrit Trigger

girls.name: girls
girls.excerpt: Like [ChuckNorris Plugin] but with different pictures. Answering to requests and for study a little how the plugins work.
girls.title: Girls Plugin

global-build-stats.name: global-build-stats
global-build-stats.excerpt: Global build stats plugin will allow to gather and display global build result statistics. It is a useful tool allowing to display global hudson build trend over time.
global-build-stats.title: Global Build Stats Plugin

googleanalytics.name: googleanalytics
googleanalytics.excerpt: This plugin decorates all web pages with the Google Analytics tracking script
googleanalytics.title: Google Analytics Plugin

googlecode.name: googlecode
googlecode.excerpt: This plugin creates links from Hudson projects to Google Code instances.
googlecode.title: Google Code Plugin

grails.name: grails
grails.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke Grails tasks as build steps.
grails.title: Grails Plugin

greenballs.name: greenballs
greenballs.excerpt: Changes Hudson to use green balls instead of blue for successful builds
greenballs.title: Green Balls

grinder.name: grinder
grinder.excerpt: This plugin reads output result files from Grinder performance tests, and will generate reports showing test results for every build and trend reports showing performance results across builds.
grinder.title: Grinder Plugin

groovy.name: groovy
groovy.excerpt: This plugin adds the ability to directly execute Groovy code.
groovy.title: Groovy plugin

groovy-postbuild.name: groovy-postbuild
groovy-postbuild.excerpt: This plugin executes a groovy script in the Hudson JVM. Typically, the script checks some conditions and changes accordingly the build result, puts badges next to the build in the build history and/or displays information on the build summary page.
groovy-postbuild.title: Groovy Postbuild Plugin

hadoop.name: hadoop
hadoop.excerpt: This plugin makes Hudson cluster act as a Hadoop cluster without any configuration.
hadoop.title: Hadoop Plugin

harvest.name: harvest
harvest.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use CA Harvest as a SCM.
harvest.title: Harvest Plugin

heavy-job.name: heavy-job
heavy-job.excerpt: This plugin allows you to define "weight" on each job, and making each job consume that many executors (instead of just one.)
heavy-job.title: Heavy Job Plugin

hgca.name: hgca
hgca.excerpt: This plugin allows the administrator to specify pairs of patterns and URLs, both globally and on a per-job level, to use for marking up changelog text.
hgca.title: HGCA Plugin

hudson-logaction-plugin.name: hudson-logaction-plugin
hudson-logaction-plugin.excerpt: Centralized configuration to restart jobs when a pattern occurs in the job console output.
hudson-logaction-plugin.title: Hudson Centralized Job(Re)Action plugin

hudson-pview-plugin.name: hudson-pview-plugin
hudson-pview-plugin.excerpt: This plugin gives every user, also non administrative one the possibility to create his own view and to use a pseudo tree-view where every user can administer it's own delimiter which is used as path delimiter
hudson-pview-plugin.title: Hudson Personal View

hudson-wsclean-plugin.name: hudson-wsclean-plugin
hudson-wsclean-plugin.excerpt: This plugin allows you to cleanup workspaces on unused slaves in the same slavegroup.
hudson-wsclean-plugin.title: Hudson Distributed Workspace Clean plugin

hudsontrayapp.name: hudsontrayapp
hudsontrayapp.excerpt: With this plugin, you can monitor your Hudson server from the comfort of you desktop tray, and even run programs when things change (or not).
hudsontrayapp.title: Hudson Tray Application

instant-messaging.name: instant-messaging
instant-messaging.excerpt: This plugin provides generic support for build notifications and a 'bot' via instant messaging protocols.
instant-messaging.title: Instant Messaging Plugin

iphoneview.name: iphoneview
iphoneview.excerpt: This plugin allows you to view the status of your jobs via iPhone or iPod touch.
iphoneview.title: iPhoneView Plugin

ircbot.name: ircbot
ircbot.excerpt: This plugin installs Hudson IRC bot on your choice of IRC channels. You can get notifications via IRC and interact with Hudson via IRC. Note that you also need to install the instant-messaging plugin .
ircbot.title: IRC Plugin

jabber.name: jabber
jabber.excerpt: Integrates Hudson with Jabber instant messaging protocol. Note that you also need to install the instant-messaging plugin.
jabber.title: Jabber Plugin

japex.name: japex
japex.excerpt: This plugin adds Japex support for Hudson so that Hudson can display trend reports and other useful metrics.
japex.title: Japex Plugin

javancss.name: javancss
javancss.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use JavaNCSS build reporting tool.
javancss.title: JavaNCSS Plugin

javanet.name: javanet
javanet.excerpt: This plugin extends Hudson for projects hosted on java.net by providing various capabilities
javanet.title: Java.net Plugin

javanet-uploader.name: javanet-uploader
javanet-uploader.excerpt: This plugin uses java.net tasks library to make Hudson capable of posting artifacts to java.net
javanet-uploader.title: java.net uploader Plugin

javatest-report.name: javatest-report
javatest-report.excerpt: This plugin enables Hudson to load test output from JavaTest test harness, which is commonly used by TCK tests for various JSRs.
javatest-report.title: JavaTest Report Plugin

jboss.name: jboss
jboss.excerpt: This plugin allows to manage a JBoss Application Server during build procedure.
jboss.title: JBoss Management Plugin

jdepend.name: jdepend
jdepend.excerpt: The JDepend Plugin is a plugin to generate JDepend reports for builds.
jdepend.title: JDepend Plugin

jobConfigHistory.name: jobConfigHistory
jobConfigHistory.excerpt: Saves copies of all job and system configurations.
jobConfigHistory.title: JobConfigHistory Plugin

jobtype-column.name: jobtype-column
jobtype-column.excerpt: Adds column showing job type that can be configured in views.
jobtype-column.title: Job Type Column Plugin

join.name: join
join.excerpt: This plugin allows a job to be run after all the immediate downstream jobs have completed.
join.title: Join Plugin

jsgames.name: jsgames
jsgames.excerpt: Play some JavaScript games from the comfort of your Jenkins instance.
jsgames.title: JSGames Plugin

jswidgets.name: jswidgets
jswidgets.excerpt: Allows embedding various statistics available from Hudson in your via javascript-snippets ala ohloh.net.
jswidgets.title: JSWidgets Plugin

junit-attachments.name: junit-attachments
junit-attachments.excerpt: This plugin can archive certain files (attachments) together with your JUnit results.
junit-attachments.title: JUnit Attachments Plugin

jython.name: jython
jython.excerpt: Adds the ability to execute Jython script from within the JVM
jython.title: Jython Plugin

klaros-testmanagement.name: klaros-testmanagement
klaros-testmanagement.excerpt: Integrates Hudson with Klaros-Testmanagement by publishing the test results of a hudson build to the Klaros-Testmanagement application. The test results will be stored in the Klaros-Testmanagement database for further evaluation and reporting purposes.
klaros-testmanagement.title: Klaros-Testmanagement Plugin

kundo.name: kundo
kundo.excerpt: This plugin allows you to invoke Kundo builds as a Hudson build step.
kundo.title: Kundo Plugin

label-verifier.name: label-verifier
label-verifier.excerpt: This plugin allows system administrator to programmatically verify the label assignment correctness on slaves.
label-verifier.title: Label Verifier Plugin

labmanager.name: labmanager
labmanager.excerpt: Add VMware Lab Manager support to Hudson
labmanager.title: Lab Manager Plugin

lastsuccessdescriptioncolumn.name: lastsuccessdescriptioncolumn
lastsuccessdescriptioncolumn.excerpt: Column showing the last success description that can be configured in views.
lastsuccessdescriptioncolumn.title: Last Success Description Column Plugin

ldapemail.name: ldapemail
ldapemail.excerpt: This plugin resolves user email addresses from an LDAP directory. It is not needed if Hudson uses LDAP as its authentication source and user records have a standard "mail" attribute.
ldapemail.title: LDAP Email Plugin

libvirt-slave.name: libvirt-slave
libvirt-slave.excerpt: Add Libvirt Hypervisor support to Hudson
libvirt-slave.title: Libvirt Slaves Plugin

locale.name: locale
locale.excerpt: This plugin controls the language of Hudson
locale.title: Locale Plugin

locked-files-report.name: locked-files-report
locked-files-report.excerpt: This debug plugin fails a build if there are locked files in the workspace at the begining or end of a build.
locked-files-report.title: Locked Files Report Plugin

locks-and-latches.name: locks-and-latches
locks-and-latches.excerpt: This plugin allows you to control the parallel execution of jobs.
locks-and-latches.title: Locks and Latches plugin

log-parser.name: log-parser
log-parser.excerpt: Parse the console output and highlight error/warning/info lines.
log-parser.title: Log Parser Plugin

m2-extra-steps.name: m2-extra-steps
m2-extra-steps.excerpt: This plugin provides the ability to add pre- and post-build steps to Maven 2-type projects.
m2-extra-steps.title: M2 Extra Steps Plugin

mantis.name: mantis
mantis.excerpt: This plugin integrates Mantis Bug Tracker to Hudson.
mantis.title: Mantis Plugin

matrixtieparent.name: matrixtieparent
matrixtieparent.excerpt: Ties the parent build of a multi-configuration project to a node.
matrixtieparent.title: Matrix Tie Parent Plugin

maven-dependency-update-trigger.name: maven-dependency-update-trigger
maven-dependency-update-trigger.excerpt: This plugin will check if any SNAPSHOT dependencies (or optionally plugins SNAPSHOT) have been updated during your project's dependencies resolution and trigger a build. You have to configure a cron expression.
maven-dependency-update-trigger.title: Maven Dependency Update trigger

maven-deployment-linker.name: maven-deployment-linker
maven-deployment-linker.excerpt: This plugin will add a summary on the build of the artifacts uploaded to your maven repository.
maven-deployment-linker.title: Maven Deployment Linker

maven-info.name: maven-info
maven-info.excerpt: Adds columns configurable in views to show info about Maven jobs.  The following Columns can be added to a view:  * Maven Modules (Short) * Maven Modules (Version) * Maven Dependencies (within groupId) * Maven Dependencies * Maven Modules (Full)
maven-info.title: Maven Info Plugin

maven-plugin.name: maven-plugin
maven-plugin.excerpt:
This plug-in provides deep integration of Hudson and Maven. This functionality used to be part of the Hudson core.
    Now it is a plug-in that is installed by default, but can be disabled.
maven-plugin.title: Hudson :: Maven (legacy) :: Plugin

measurement-plots.name: measurement-plots
measurement-plots.excerpt: Plot measurements embedded into the standard output and error streams of tests.
measurement-plots.title: Measurement Plots Plugin

mercurial.name: mercurial
mercurial.excerpt: This plugin integrates the Mercurial version control system with Hudson.
mercurial.title: Mercurial Plugin

mozmill.name: mozmill
mozmill.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use Mozmill for automated tests in Gecko based applications such as Firefox and Thunderbird.
mozmill.title: Mozmill Plugin

mstest.name: mstest
mstest.excerpt: This plugin converts MSTest TRX test reports into JUnit XML reports so it can be integrated with Hudson's JUnit features.
mstest.title: MSTest Plugin

multiline-tabbar-plugin.name: multiline-tabbar-plugin
multiline-tabbar-plugin.title: Extension Point for Project Views Navigation

mysql-auth.name: mysql-auth
mysql-auth.excerpt: This plugin allows users to authenticate to a Hudson instance using credentials stored in a MySQL database.
mysql-auth.title: MySQL Authentication Plugin

nabaztag.name: nabaztag
nabaztag.excerpt: Publish the result of a build to a Nabaztag.
nabaztag.title: Nabaztag Plugin

naginator.name: naginator
naginator.excerpt: This plugin allows you to automatically reschedule a build after a build failure.
naginator.title: Naginator Plugin

nant.name: nant
nant.excerpt: This plugin allows for the execution of a NAnt build as a Hudson build step.
nant.title: NAnt Plugin

ncover.name: ncover
ncover.excerpt: Archive and publish .NET code coverage HTML reports from NCover.
ncover.title: NCover Plugin

nested-view.name: nested-view
nested-view.excerpt: View type to allow grouping job views into multiple levels instead of one big list of tabs.
nested-view.title: Nested View Plugin

next-build-number.name: next-build-number
next-build-number.excerpt: This is a simple plugin that changes the next build number Hudson will use for a job.
next-build-number.title: Next Build Number Plugin

nodejs.name: nodejs
nodejs.excerpt: Executes NodeJS script as a build step.
nodejs.title: NodeJS Plugin

nodenamecolumn.name: nodenamecolumn
nodenamecolumn.excerpt: Adds column showing node name and can be configured in views.
nodenamecolumn.title: Node Name Column Plugin

notifo.name: notifo
notifo.excerpt: Integration with the Notifo API to push build notifications to mobile devices.
notifo.title: Notifo Plugin

nsiqcollector.name: nsiqcollector
nsiqcollector.excerpt: This plugin shows the lines of code and cyclomatic complexity from from extenal metric tools named N'SIQ Collector(http://dev.naver.com/projects/nsiqcollector).
nsiqcollector.title: NSIQ Collector Plugin

nunit.name: nunit
nunit.excerpt: This plugin allows you to publish NUnit test results.
nunit.title: NUnit Plugin

origo-issue-notifier.name: origo-issue-notifier
origo-issue-notifier.excerpt: This plugin opens or updates an issue on an Origo instance based on the build result.
origo-issue-notifier.title: Origo Issue Notifier

parameterized-trigger.name: parameterized-trigger
parameterized-trigger.excerpt: This plugin lets you trigger new builds when your build has completed, with various ways of specifying parameters for the new build.
parameterized-trigger.title: Parameterized Trigger Plugin

performance.name: performance
performance.excerpt: This plugin allows you to capture reports from JMeter and JUnit . Hudson will generate graphic charts with the trend report of performance and robustness. It includes the feature of setting the final build status as good, unstable or failed, based on the reported error percentage.
performance.title: Performance Plugin

perfpublisher.name: perfpublisher
perfpublisher.excerpt: This plugin generates global and trend reports for tests results analysis. Based on an open XML tests results format, the plugin parses the generated files and publish statistics, reports and analysis on the current health of the project.
perfpublisher.title: PerfPublisher Plugin

persona.name: persona
persona.excerpt: This plugin lets you define custom personalities like Chuck Norris or Bruce Schneier just by preparing an XML file and a few image files.
persona.title: Persona Plugin

phing.name: phing
phing.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use Phing to build PHP projects.
phing.title: Phing Plugin

piwikanalytics.name: piwikanalytics
piwikanalytics.excerpt: This plugin decorates all web pages with the Piwik Analytics tracking script.
piwikanalytics.title: Piwik Analytics Plugin

platformlabeler.name: platformlabeler
platformlabeler.excerpt: This plugin adds node labels based on the platform the node is running; they are updated each time the node connects.
platformlabeler.title: PlatformLabeler Plugin

play-autotest-plugin.name: play-autotest-plugin
play-autotest-plugin.excerpt: This plugin integrates Play! framework to Hudson. It enables hudson to run play commands and to generate test-result view per build looks like Calimoucho ??? Play! CI server.
play-autotest-plugin.title: play-plugin

plot.name: plot
plot.excerpt: This plugin provides generic plotting (or graphing) capabilities in Hudson.
plot.title: Plot Plugin

polarion.name: polarion
polarion.excerpt: This plugin integrates the Polarion WebClient for SVN, an open source, web based interface to Subversion.
polarion.title: Polarion Plugin

port-allocator.name: port-allocator
port-allocator.excerpt: Assigns unique TCP port addresses to jobs so that jobs executed concurrently won't collide with each other. Also performs clean ups to kill off daemons that are forked by jobs.
port-allocator.title: Port Allocator Plugin

postbuild-task.name: postbuild-task
postbuild-task.excerpt: This plugin allows the user to execute a shell/batch task depending on the build log output. Java regular expression are allowed.
postbuild-task.title: Post build task

promoted-builds.name: promoted-builds
promoted-builds.excerpt: This plugin allows you to distinguish good builds from bad builds by introducing the notion of 'promotion'.
promoted-builds.title: Hudson promoted builds plugin

promoted-builds-simple.name: promoted-builds-simple
promoted-builds-simple.excerpt: Simpler version of [Promoted Builds Plugin], with only manual promotion of builds.
promoted-builds-simple.title: Promoted Builds Simple Plugin

pvcs_scm.name: pvcs_scm
pvcs_scm.excerpt: This plugin provides integration with Serena's PVCS Version Manager SCM.
pvcs_scm.title: PVCS SCM

pwauth.name: pwauth
pwauth.excerpt: This plug-in adds authentication via pwauth and supports both \*nix system users and groups through PAM.
pwauth.title: pwauth

pxe.name: pxe
pxe.excerpt: This plugin enhances Hudson to support network-booting PCs for rapid, hands-free installations of various OSes, thereby making new slave installations easier.
pxe.title: PXE Plugin

python.name: python
python.excerpt: Adds the ability to execute python scripts as build steps.
python.title: Python Plugin

qc.name: qc
qc.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to trigger HP Quality Center test sets.
qc.title: Quality Center Plugin

rake.name: rake
rake.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke Rake tasks as build steps.
rake.title: Rake plugin

rebuild.name: rebuild
rebuild.excerpt: This plugin allows the user to _rebuild_ a _parameterized build_ without entering the _parameters_ again.
rebuild.title: Rebuild Plugin

redmine.name: redmine
redmine.excerpt: This plugin integrates Redmine into Hudson (there's a plugin for Redmine that integrates Hudson from the Redmine side, too.)
redmine.title: Redmine Plugin

regexemail.name: regexemail
regexemail.excerpt: This plugin allows you to generate user email addresses from usernames.
regexemail.title: RegEx Email Plugin

release.name: release
release.excerpt: This plugin adds the ability to wrap your job with pre\- and post\- build steps which are only executed when a manual release build is triggered.
release.title: Release Plugin

repository-connector.name: repository-connector
repository-connector.excerpt: Repository Connector adds a build step which allows to resolve artifacts from a maven repository like nexus. In future it will also allow to deploy artifacts to the same repo.
repository-connector.title: Repository Connector Plugin

reviewboard.name: reviewboard
reviewboard.excerpt: This plugin connects to Reviewboard to create and update Review Requests. Reviewboard is a tool for conducting code reviews and this plugin will allow you to link your SCM updates, when they are pulled for a Hudson build, to Reviewboard. Note that currently, only the Perforce SCM is supported.
reviewboard.title: Reviewboard Plugin

ruby.name: ruby
ruby.excerpt: This plugin will let users use Ruby in the build scripts.
ruby.title: Ruby Plugin

rubyMetrics.name: rubyMetrics
rubyMetrics.excerpt: Ruby metric reports for Hudson. Rcov, Rails stats, Rails notes and Flog.
rubyMetrics.title: Ruby metrics plugin

saferestart.name: saferestart
saferestart.excerpt: This plugin will add 'Restart Safely' link on the sidebar and management page.
saferestart.title: SafeRestart Plugin

sauce-ondemand.name: sauce-ondemand
sauce-ondemand.excerpt: This plugin allows you to integrate Sauce OnDemand to Hudson.
sauce-ondemand.title: Hudson Sauce OnDemand plugin

sbt.name: sbt
sbt.excerpt: This plugin allows building Scala projects using sbt.
sbt.title: sbt plugin

schedule-failed-builds.name: schedule-failed-builds
schedule-failed-builds.excerpt: Allows you to retry failed Hudson builds every n minutes.
schedule-failed-builds.title: Retry Failed Builds Plugin

scp.name: scp
scp.excerpt: This plugin uploads build artifacts to repository sites using SCP (SSH) protocol.
scp.title: SCP plugin

screenshot.name: screenshot
screenshot.excerpt: Shows a screenshot of a running build.
screenshot.title: Screenshot Plugin

script-realm.name: script-realm
script-realm.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use a user-written custom script to authenticate the username and password
script-realm.title: Script Security Realm

scriptler.name: scriptler
scriptler.excerpt: Scriptler allows you to store/edit/execute groovy scripts on any of the slaves/nodes... no need for copy paste groovy code anymore. Beside administer  your scripts, Scritpler also provides a way to share scripts between users via hosted script catalogs on the internet. At http://scriptlerweb.appspot.com you are not only able to find scripts and import it via scriptler in to your hudson instance, but can also share your own scripts. All you need is a nice script other people might like too and an OpenId login. A login is only needed if you would like to share a script - If you have a google acount, your already fine, but any other will do too (OpenId, Yahoo, AOL, ...). Please share your scripts at http://scriptlerweb.appspot.com
scriptler.title: Scriptler Plugin

secret.name: secret
secret.excerpt: Lets you upload secret files to be used by a build.
secret.title: Build Secret Plugin

sectioned-view.name: sectioned-view
sectioned-view.excerpt: This plugin provides a new view implementation that can be divided into sections. Each section can display different information about the selected jobs.  An extension point is also provided to define new types of sections.
sectioned-view.title: Sectioned View Plugin

selenium.name: selenium
selenium.excerpt: This plugin turns your Hudson cluster into a Selenium Grid cluster
selenium.title: Selenium Plugin

selenium-aes.name: selenium-aes
selenium-aes.excerpt: This plugin is for continuous regression test by Selenium Auto Exec Server (AES).
selenium-aes.title: Selenium AES Plugin

seleniumhq.name: seleniumhq
seleniumhq.excerpt: This plugin allows you to run and load HTML Selenese suite result generate by Selenium Server from Seleniumhq. Hudson will generate the trend report of test result. The Seleniumhq plug in can be downloadsed here.
seleniumhq.title: Seleniumhq Plugin

seleniumhtmlreport.name: seleniumhtmlreport
seleniumhtmlreport.excerpt: This plugin visualizes the results of selenium tests.
seleniumhtmlreport.title: seleniumhtmlreport Plugin

serenity.name: serenity
serenity.excerpt: Serenity is a Java code coverage, complexity and dependency library that uses dynamic instrumentation, with a friendly Hudson ui.
serenity.title: Serenity Plugin

setenv.name: setenv
setenv.excerpt: Set environment variables for a project, to be referenced during build steps.
setenv.title: Setenv Plugin

sfee.name: sfee
sfee.excerpt: Authenticate users and publish build artifacts relying on a Collabnet Source Forge Enterprise Edition (SFEE) server.
sfee.title: SFEE Plugin

shelve-project-plugin.name: shelve-project-plugin
shelve-project-plugin.excerpt: This plugin lets you shelve projects so that they can easily be resurrected.
shelve-project-plugin.title: Shelve Project Plugin

sidebar-link.name: sidebar-link
sidebar-link.excerpt: Add links in the sidebar of the Hudson main page, view tabs and project pages.
sidebar-link.title: Sidebar-Link Plugin

slave-squatter.name: slave-squatter
slave-squatter.excerpt: This plugin enables administrators to reserve executors to be used outside Hudson.
slave-squatter.title: Slave Squatter Plugin

slave-status.name: slave-status
slave-status.excerpt: Monitor the status of Hudson slaves.
slave-status.title: slave-status

sloccount.name: sloccount
sloccount.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for SLOCCount, an open source program which counts the number of lines of codes in over 25 different languages, including C/C++, Ada, COBOL, Fortran, SQL, Ruby, Python, etc...
sloccount.title: SLOCCount Plugin

sonar.name: sonar
sonar.excerpt: Quickly benefit from Sonar, an open-source Code Quality Management Platform based on many well known analysis tools like Checkstyle, PMD, Findbugs, Cobertura, ....
sonar.title: Sonar Plugin

sounds.name: sounds
sounds.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to play arbitrary audio clips as build notifications.
sounds.title: Hudson Sounds plugin

speaks.name: speaks
speaks.excerpt: This plugin gives Hudson a voice using FreeTTS.
speaks.title: Hudson Speaks! Plugin

staf.name: staf
staf.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke a STAF command or launch a STAX job as a build step.
staf.title: STAF - STAX Plugin

starteam.name: starteam
starteam.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson with StarTeam, Borland's crossplatform SCM solution.
starteam.title: StarTeam

startup-trigger-plugin.name: startup-trigger-plugin
startup-trigger-plugin.excerpt: The Startup Trigger plugin allows you to trigger a Hudson build when Hudson is first started.
startup-trigger-plugin.title: Startup Trigger

status-view.name: status-view
status-view.excerpt: View type to show jobs filtered by the status of the last completed build.
status-view.title: Status View Plugin

statusmonitor.name: statusmonitor
statusmonitor.excerpt: This plugin shows the state of selected jobs visually on a single screen.
statusmonitor.title: Status Monitor Plugin

svn-release-mgr.name: svn-release-mgr
svn-release-mgr.excerpt: This plugin allows you to set up a job in Hudson for building specific revisions of a project.
svn-release-mgr.title: Subversion Release Manager

svn-tag.name: svn-tag
svn-tag.excerpt: This plugin automatically performs subversion tagging (technically speaking svn copy) on successful build.
svn-tag.title: Subversion Tagging Plugin

svncompat13.name: svncompat13
svncompat13.excerpt: This plugin forces the built-in SVNKit library to use the Subversion 1.3 working copy format (instead of the most recent one it supports).
svncompat13.title: SVNCompat13 Plugin

svncompat14.name: svncompat14
svncompat14.excerpt: This plugin forces the built-in SVNKit library to use the Subversion 1.4 working copy format (instead of the most recent one it supports).
svncompat14.title: SVNCompat14 Plugin

svnpublisher.name: svnpublisher
svnpublisher.excerpt: This plugin allows you to upload artifacts to a subversion repository. This is done via a delete/import of the items requested.
svnpublisher.title: SVN Publisher

swarm.name: swarm
swarm.excerpt: This plugin enables slaves to auto-discover nearby Hudson master and join it automatically, thereby forming an ad-hoc cluster.
swarm.title: Swarm Plugin

synergy.name: synergy
synergy.excerpt: This plugin provide integrations with IBM Rational CM/Synergy 6.5a Version Manager SCM
synergy.title: Synergy Plugin

systemloadaverage-monitor.name: systemloadaverage-monitor
systemloadaverage-monitor.excerpt: Use to display the System Load Average of unix nodes.
systemloadaverage-monitor.title: System Load Average Monitor Plugin

template-project.name: template-project
template-project.excerpt: This plugin lets you use builders, publishers and SCM settings from another project.
template-project.title: Template Project Plugin

terminal.name: terminal
terminal.excerpt: This plugin allows you to execute OS commands.
terminal.title: Terminal Plugin

testabilityexplorer.name: testabilityexplorer
testabilityexplorer.excerpt: This plugin generates trend reports for the Testability Explorer, an open source program which uses byte-code analysis to look for testability pitfalls in Java code.
testabilityexplorer.title: Testability Explorer Plugin

testlink.name: testlink
testlink.excerpt: This plug-in integrates *Hudson* and *TestLink* and generates reports on automated test execution.With this plug-in you can +manage+ your tests in *TestLink*, +schedule and control+ in *Hudson*, and +execute+ using your favorite *test execution tool*. Nice uhn?
testlink.title: TestLink Plugin

testng-plugin.name: testng-plugin
testng-plugin.excerpt: This plugin allows you publish TestNG results.  {excerpt}  TestNG result xml file contains more information than the junit report xml file . This plugin exposes those extra information in graph and table reports.   This plugin makes it possible to import TestNG XML reports from each build into Hudson.   The data is parsed using the output generated using org.testng.reporters.XMLReporter. The results are displayed with a trend graph and all details about which tests that failed are also presented.  Features : The page layouts are intentionally designed to look very similar to Hudson's junit plugin.  * In the project/build page you can see a summary of passed/fail tests as well as passed/fail configuration methods. It also enlists the failed test cases with a direct link to view the test failure. !test-summary.png! * In the Class result summary page test methods are separated from configuration methods !test-result.png! * In the Package result summary you can see the order which test methods were ran during the regression run. !execution-order.png! * Different graphs will show you the pass/failed trend of job's previous results. !test-graph.png! * Able to hide/expand tables that display package and class results  Usage : # Job Configuation : You need to specify an ant compatible search path where testng plugin will look for testng resutl xml files. If your result xml files are not located under job/workspace and you need to specify a relative path , make sure that the below checkbox is selected. !job-configuration.png!
testng-plugin.title: testng-plugin

text-finder.name: text-finder
text-finder.excerpt: This plugin lets you search keywords in the files you specified and use that to mark the build as success or a failure.
text-finder.title: Text-finder Plugin

tfs.name: tfs
tfs.excerpt: This plugin integrates Microsoft Team Foundation Server source control to Hudson.
tfs.title: Team Foundation Server Plugin

thinBackup.name: thinBackup
thinBackup.excerpt: This plugin simply backs up the global and job specific configurations (not the archive or the workspace).
thinBackup.title: thinBackup

throttle-concurrents.name: throttle-concurrents
throttle-concurrents.excerpt: This plugin allows for throttling the number of concurrent builds of a project running per node or globally.
throttle-concurrents.title: Throttle Concurrent Builds Plugin

timestamper.name: timestamper
timestamper.excerpt: Adds timestamps to the Console Output.
timestamper.title: Timestamper

tmpcleaner.name: tmpcleaner
tmpcleaner.excerpt: This plugin allows you to cleanup JVM temporary files.
tmpcleaner.title: Tmp Cleaner Plugin

toolenv.name: toolenv
toolenv.excerpt: Lets you use "tools" in unusual ways, such as from shell scripts.
toolenv.title: Tool Environment Plugin

trac.name: trac
trac.excerpt: This plugin creates links from Hudson projects to Trac instances.
trac.title: Trac Plugin

tracking-svn.name: tracking-svn
tracking-svn.excerpt: Lets one project track the Subversion revisions that are checked out for another project.
tracking-svn.title: Tracking SVN Plugin

translation.name: translation
translation.excerpt: This plugin adds an additional dialog box in every page, which enables people to contribute localizations for the messages they are seeing in the current page.
translation.title: Translation Assistance Plugin

tusarnotifier.name: tusarnotifier
tusarnotifier.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to convert the results of an execution of a metric tool and send Tusar outputs to Sonar.
tusarnotifier.title: TusarNotifier

tuxdroid.name: tuxdroid
tuxdroid.excerpt: Allows to publish the result of a build to a TuxDroid.
tuxdroid.title: TuxDroid Plugin

twitter.name: twitter
twitter.excerpt: This plugin posts build results to Twitter.
twitter.title: Twitter Plugin

unity-asset-server.name: unity-asset-server
unity-asset-server.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use Unity Asset Server as a SCM.
unity-asset-server.title: Unity Asset Server Plugin

url-change-trigger.name: url-change-trigger
url-change-trigger.excerpt: The URL Change Trigger plugin allows you to trigger a Hudson build when the content of a URL changes.
url-change-trigger.title: URL Change Trigger

validating-string-parameter.name: validating-string-parameter
validating-string-parameter.excerpt: The validating string parameter plugin contributes a new parameter type to Hudson that supports regular expression validation of the user's entered parameter.
validating-string-parameter.title: Validating String Parameter Plugin

versionnumber.name: versionnumber
versionnumber.excerpt: This plugin creates a new version number and stores it in the environment variable whose name you specify in the configuration.
versionnumber.title: Version Number Plugin

view-job-filters.name: view-job-filters
view-job-filters.excerpt: Manage multiple views and hundreds of jobs much more easily.  Include or exclude jobs from a view using things like the SCM path or type, the job type, build statuses or trends, email recipients, Maven configuration, job parameterization, and user permissions.  Mix and match filters to narrow down to exactly what you want.
view-job-filters.title: View Job Filters

viewVC.name: viewVC
viewVC.excerpt: This plugin integrates ViewVC browser interface for CVS and Subversion with Hudson.
viewVC.title: ViewVC Plugin

violations.name: violations
violations.excerpt: This plug-in generates reports static code violation detectors such as checkstyle, pmd, cpd, findbugs, fxcop, stylecop and simian.
violations.title: Violations

virtualbox.name: virtualbox
virtualbox.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson with VirtualBox virtual machine.
virtualbox.title: VirtualBox Plugin

vmware.name: vmware
vmware.excerpt: This plugin allows you to start a VMware Virtual Machine before a build and stop it again after the build completes.
vmware.title: VMware plugin

vss.name: vss
vss.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson with Microsoft Visual SourceSafe
vss.title: Visual SourceSafe Plugin

was-builder.name: was-builder
was-builder.excerpt: This plugin allows Jenkins to invoke IBM WebSphere Application Server's *wsadmin* as a build step.
was-builder.title: WAS Builder Plugin

webtestpresenter.name: webtestpresenter
webtestpresenter.excerpt: This plugin publishes the reports generated by the Canoo WebTest tool for each build.
webtestpresenter.title: WebTest Presenter Plugin

windmill.name: windmill
windmill.excerpt: This plugin allows you to configure and run Windmill functional tests.
windmill.title: Windmill Plugin

xfpanel.name: xfpanel
xfpanel.excerpt: Provides an eXtreme Feedback Panel for Hudson. Thanks to Mark Howard and his work on the Radiator View Plugin from which this was based.
xfpanel.title: eXtreme Feedback Panel

xshell.name: xshell
xshell.excerpt: This plugin defines a new build type to execute a shell command in a cross-platform environment.
xshell.title: XShell Plugin

xvnc.name: xvnc
xvnc.excerpt: This plugin lets you run an Xvnc session during a build. This is handy if your build includes UI testing that needs a display available.
xvnc.title: Xvnc Plugin

clearcase-release.name: clearcase-release
clearcase-release.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to promote composite baselines or latest baselines to RELEASED promotion level for Clearcase UCM.
clearcase-release.title: ClearCase Release Plugin

clearcase-ucm-baseline.name: clearcase-ucm-baseline
clearcase-ucm-baseline.excerpt: Allows using ClearCase UCM baselines as the input of builds: When using this SCM, users will be asked at build-time to select the baseline on which the job has to work.
clearcase-ucm-baseline.title: ClearCase UCM Baseline Plugin

copy-to-slave.name: copy-to-slave
copy-to-slave.excerpt: This plugin allows to copy a set of files, from a location somewhere on the master node, to jobs' workspaces. It also allows to copy files back from the workspaces of jobs located on a slave node to their workspaces on the master one.
copy-to-slave.title: Copy To Slave Plugin

cppcheck.name: cppcheck
cppcheck.excerpt: This plugin records CppCheck reports in Jenkins.
cppcheck.title: Cppcheck Plugin

gradle.name: gradle
gradle.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to invoke Gradle build script as the main build step.
gradle.title: Gradle Plugin

ivy.name: ivy
ivy.excerpt: This plugin automatically configures a build to trigger other builds based on dependency configuration via Apache Ivy.
ivy.title: Ivy Plugin

jira.name: jira
jira.excerpt: This plugin integrates Atlassian JIRA to Jenkins.
jira.title: JIRA Plugin

rad-builder.name: rad-builder
rad-builder.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke IBM Rational Application Developer as a build step.
rad-builder.title: RAD Builder Plugin

zentimestamp.name: zentimestamp
zentimestamp.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to change the Jenkins build timestamp format (provided by the Jenkins BUILD_ID variable).
zentimestamp.title: ZenTimestamp Plugin

xunit.name: xunit
xunit.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to publish the test results of an execution of a testing tool in Jenkins.
xunit.title: xUnit Plugin

m2release.name: m2release
m2release.excerpt: This plugin allows you to perform a release build using the maven-release-plugin from within Jenkins.
m2release.title: M2 Release Plugin

robot.name: robot
robot.excerpt: This plugin collects and publishes Robot Framework test results
robot.title: Robot Framework Plugin

bulk-builder.name: bulk-builder
bulk-builder.excerpt: Trigger multiple builds with ease. Designed for users with many jobs.
bulk-builder.title: Bulk Builder Plugin

msbuild.name: msbuild
msbuild.excerpt: This plugin allows you to use MSBuild to build .NET projects.
msbuild.title: MSBuild Plugin

gallio.name: gallio
gallio.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to publish Gallio/MbUnit test results
gallio.title: Gallio Plugin

gnat.name: gnat
gnat.excerpt: This plugin makes it possible to integrate Gnat features for ADA languages in Jenkins.
gnat.title: Gnat Plugin

jsunit.name: jsunit
jsunit.excerpt: This plugin allows you publish JSUnit test results
jsunit.title: JSUnit plugin

cccc.name: cccc
cccc.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for CCCC (C and C+\+ Code Counter).
cccc.title: CCCC Plugin

jobrevision.name: jobrevision
jobrevision.excerpt: This plugin enables users to set a revision (a version) for the Jenkins job.
jobrevision.title: JobRevision Plugin

radiatorviewplugin.name: radiatorviewplugin
radiatorviewplugin.excerpt: Provides a job view displaying project status in a highly visible manner. This is ideal for displaying on a screen on the office wall as a form of Extreme Feedback Device.
radiatorviewplugin.title: Radiator View Plugin

job-exporter.name: job-exporter
job-exporter.excerpt: Adds a build step that exports runtime parameters into a properties file (e.g who triggered the build, what is her email address...). This information can be read by other build steps.
job-exporter.title: Job Exporter Plugin

scons.name: scons
scons.excerpt: This plugin allows Hudson to invoke SCons build script as the main build step.
scons.title: SCons Plugin

mask-passwords.name: mask-passwords
mask-passwords.excerpt: This plugin allows masking passwords that may appear in the console
mask-passwords.title: Mask Passwords Plugin

pmd.name: pmd
pmd.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for PMD, an open source static code analysis program.
pmd.title: PMD Plugin

warnings.name: warnings
warnings.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for compiler warnings in the console log or in log files.
warnings.title: Warnings Plugin

cpptest.name: cpptest
cpptest.excerpt: This plugin allows you publish Parasoft C++test test results. This plugin makes it possible to import Parasoft C++test reports from each build into Hudson so they are displayed with a trend graph and details about which tests that failed.
cpptest.title: Cpptest Plugin

monitoring.name: monitoring
monitoring.excerpt: Monitoring plugin: Monitoring of Jenkins / Hudson itself with JavaMelody. Open the report (or [http://yourhost/monitoring]) after installation.
monitoring.title: Monitoring

perforce.name: perforce
perforce.excerpt: Integrates Jenkins with Perforce SCM Repositories.
perforce.title: Perforce Plugin

analysis-core.name: analysis-core
analysis-core.excerpt: This plug-in provides utilities for the static code analysis plug-ins.
analysis-core.title: Static Code Analysis Plug-ins

checkstyle.name: checkstyle
checkstyle.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for Checkstyle, an open source static code analysis program.
checkstyle.title: Checkstyle Plugin

findbugs.name: findbugs
findbugs.excerpt: This plugin generates the trend report for FindBugs, an open source program which uses static analysis to look for bugs in Java code.
findbugs.title: FindBugs Plugin

role-strategy.name: role-strategy
role-strategy.excerpt: Adds a new role-based strategy to manage users' permissions.
role-strategy.title: Role Strategy Plugin

tasks.name: tasks
tasks.excerpt: This plugin scans the workspace files for open tasks and generates a trend report.
tasks.title: Task Scanner Plugin

github.name: github
github.excerpt: This plugin integrates Hudson with Github projects.
github.title: Github Plugin

doxygen.name: doxygen
doxygen.excerpt: This plugin publishes HTML reports generated by the Doxygen tool.
doxygen.title: Doxygen Plugin

sicci_for_xcode.name: sicci_for_xcode
sicci_for_xcode.excerpt: This plugin integrates support for Xcode projects
sicci_for_xcode.title: SICCI for Xcode Plugin

build-pipeline-plugin.name: build-pipeline-plugin
build-pipeline-plugin.excerpt: This plugin provides build pipeline functionality to Hudson and Jenkins.  This allows a chain of jobs to be visualised in a new view.  Manual jobs in the pipeline can be triggered by a user with the appropriate permissions manually confirming.
build-pipeline-plugin.title: Build Pipeline Plugin

serenitec.name: serenitec
serenitec.excerpt:
Execute the Serenitec refactoring solution on your project and
    generate reports on its activities.
serenitec.title: Hudson Serenitec Plugin.

ConfigurationSlicing.name: ConfigurationSlicing
ConfigurationSlicing.excerpt: Allows configuration of a single property across a group of projects
ConfigurationSlicing.title: Configuration Slicing plugin

maven-repository-server.name: maven-repository-server
maven-repository-server.excerpt: Hudson Maven Repository Server Plugin exposes builds that use the Maven3 integration as Maven repositories
maven-repository-server.title: Hudson Maven Repository Server Plugin

displayname.name: displayname
displayname.excerpt: Display Name Plugin adds a extra display name to jobs and a column to show it
displayname.title: Display Name

labelColumnView.name: labelColumnView
labelColumnView.excerpt: Displays the label of the last build in a column.
labelColumnView.title: Label Column Plugin

crowd2.name: crowd2
crowd2.excerpt: SecurityRealm that enables the use of Atlassian's Crowd identity management server.
crowd2.title: Crowd 2 Integration

liverebel-deploy.name: liverebel-deploy
liverebel-deploy.excerpt: LiveRebel Deploy Plugin helps to run updates to your JEE containers faster. LiveRebel is tool for hot updates without downtime, lost sesions and OutOfMemoryErrors. You have to have runing LiveRebel installed to use this plugin.
liverebel-deploy.title: LiveRebel Deploy Plugin

weblogic-deployer-plugin.name: weblogic-deployer-plugin
weblogic-deployer-plugin.excerpt: This plugin deploy artifacts built on a CI server Hudson to a weblogic target (managed server, cluster ...) as an application or a library component.
weblogic-deployer-plugin.title: Hudson WebLogic Deployer Plug-in

JumbleHudsonPlugin.name: JumbleHudsonPlugin
JumbleHudsonPlugin.excerpt: "This plugin will read the jumble xml report and generate a graph with the trend over time.It will also generate a report with the score for each package and class. "
JumbleHudsonPlugin.title: JumbleHudsonPlugin
